result.execSummary:
The defendant DANIELLE JO MARCHINOWSKI was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Consecutive to each other and consecutive to any other sentence. No huber. Court grants the defendant 335 days of sentence credit on 2021CF97 & 2022CF19.
-Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

1:48 PM Defendant DANIELLE JO MARCHINOWSKI in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for DANIELLE JO MARCHINOWSKI.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2021CF54, 2021CF97 & 2022CF19. Atty Kapelis has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions. State has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions. Sentencing statement by DA Laspisa. Sentencing statement by Atty Kapelis. Statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2021CF54 (OWI-4th)

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-3 months county jail. To commence immediately. Sentence is to be consecutive to any other sentence. No huber.
-$1,000 fine plus costs.
-Blood Draw Fee - $50.00
-DL Revocation - lifetime
-AODA
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court grants the defendant 13 days of sentence credit if probation is revoked.

2021CF97 (BJ-felony) / 2022CF19 (BJ-felony) - EACH:

-1 year county jail, consecutive to each other and consecutive to any other sentence. No huber.
-Court costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court grants the defendant 335 days of sentence credit on 2021CF97 & 2022CF19.

Statement by Atty Kapelis re: huber. Statement by the Court.

Court adjourned at 2:11 PM
Sentencing hearing on August 29, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Sentencing hearing on September 6, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:23 PM Defendant DANIELLE JO MARCHINOWSKI in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for DANIELLE JO MARCHINOWSKI on 21CF54 and 21CF97. Court calls 2021CF54, 2021CF97, 2021CF124 & 2022CF19. Court recites agreement, defendant will plea to OWI-4th in 2021CF54 with probation and conditions and will plea to BJ in 2021CF97 with jail, costs and DNA sample. DA Laspisa recites agreement on 2021CF124, will be dismissed and read-in and in 2022CF19, defendant will enter a plea to one count. Defendant agrees. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver on 2021CF124 & 22CF19. 

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 in 2021CF54, dismissing the alcohol fine enhancer and orders counts 2 & 3 be dismissed and read-in and count 4 be dismissed outright. in 2021CF97, court finds the defendant guilty as charged. In 2022CF19, court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 and orders counts 2 & 3 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders 2021CF124 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Court orders a Presentence investigation be completed and copies filed with the court.  

Court adjourned at 2:34 PM

Court sets for sentencing on September 6, 2022 at 11:30 AM.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Order to Withdraw (Atty Gary Schmaus)
Order to Withdraw (Atty Gary Schmaus)
Affidavit of Counsel
to Withdraw (Atty Schmaus)
Return date on May 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

4:01 PM Defendant DANIELLE JO MARCHINOWSKI appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Gary R Schmaus appeared by video for DANIELLE JO MARCHINOWSKI, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Schmaus states the defendant will waive the preliminary hearing. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy emailed to Atty Schmaus. Attorney Schmaus acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Schmaus enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. 

Court adjourned at 4:04 PM

Court will set all cases for Return Date on May 16, 2022 at 10:30 AM.
